tweet_text: It‚Äôs important not to lose sight that Iran‚Äôs nuclear threat is not the only area of concern. Iran must be held accountable for its role as the largest state sponsor of terrorism & malign activities in the region ‚Äì particularly given the current political instability in Iraq. 7/8

tweet_text: As I‚Äôve monitored the process in Vienna, certain reports on proposals in the negotiations have been concerning. 4/8

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: When it comes to addressing climate change, every step forward is important.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: Achieving carbon pollution-free power generation while ensuring our national security is critical. I introduced my amendment to require each service to assess whether or not they can meet that goal & what steps we can take to help them.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: Did you know that the Department of Defense is the world's largest institutional emitter of greenhouse gasses? In its 2022 Climate Strategy, the Army set an important goal -- to achieve 100% carbon pollution-free power generation on its installations by 2040.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: I strongly support the Army's efforts, which is why I introduced my amendment to urge the Navy and Air Force to continue their progress and report to Congress on their own efforts to achieve full microgrid adoption by 2035.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: Microgrids improve electricity reliability, enhance resilience and recovery, lower energy costs, and can even help our grids lower cybersecurity risks. That's why the Army has set a goal to install microgrids on every military base by 2035.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: Curbing the capacity of these guns will keep residents safe and also protect our law enforcement.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: From my weapons training in the Navy, I know that there is absolutely no need for high-capacity magazines for hunting or self-defense. For this reason, I voted for the Keep Americans Safe Act to prohibit the possession or transfers of high-capacity ammunition magazines.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: I voted for the bipartisan Closing the Bump Stock Loophole Act, which will regulate bump stocks in the same way as machine guns and the deadliest weapons.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: In the tragic Las Vegas shooting, 60 innocent Americans died because of the use of a bump stock, a device that allows semi-automatic weapons to mimic fully automatic firing.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: I proudly voted for @RepSlotkin‚Äôs Safe Guns, Safe Kids Act, as well as the Kimberly Vaughan Firearm Safe Storage Act and Ethan‚Äôs Law, to keep our kids safe nationwide.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: Laws that teach and instruct gun owners how to safely store firearms and ammunition are critical to preventing minors and others from accessing them.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: I voted for the Untraceable Firearms Act, which will close the ghost gun loophole and make sure no one can evade safety measures by building weapons at home instead of buying them safely from a store.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: Ghost guns threaten our safety by giving people access to untraceable weapons with no background check, serial number, or questions asked.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: New Jersey has strong gun laws that are protecting our communities, but are undermined by the states around us that lack them. I voted for the Prevent Gun Trafficking Act to combat illegal gun purchases and transfers as well as back-up our state-level gun safety laws.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: From Columbine to Uvalde, a disturbing number of mass shooters are teenagers. With the Raise the Age Act, I voted to raise the national age requirement for purchasing military-style assault weapons from 18 to 21, identical to our handgun purchasing laws.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: Follow thisüßµto learn about each bill I advanced to save American lives and break the cycle of violence in our country.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: We‚Äôve made important progress in helping Americans get back to work over the past year, and I‚Äôm confident that these investments will create a stronger and more innovative workforce for decades to come.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: So much of this disparity is a result of a lack of affordable childcare access, making the passage of cost-cutting measures for NJ‚Äôs families an even greater priority.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: I am also still focused on supporting working moms as we emerge from the pandemic. Almost twice as many women have still not returned to work following job loss during the pandemic compared to men.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: Job growth is strong and I‚Äôm working hard to relieve the inflationary pressures on families by addressing disruptions in our port system, trucking sector, and semiconductor industry.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: The Bipartisan Infrastructure Law is continuing these important investments and creating thousands of jobs in North Jersey through the completion of the Gateway Tunnel project and other critical infrastructure developments.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: This progress highlights the importance of the investments in NJ‚Äôs workforce, families, and communities that have been made in the past year, including critical funds for our state and local governments and our education system.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: New Jersey has also seen a robust jobs recovery. Our economy gained 134,000 new jobs in the 2nd half of last year, and unemployment has fallen from a pandemic high of 16.6% to just 4.9% in December.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: Great news out yesterday that our economy created 678,000 jobs in February, the most since last July, and the unemployment rate fell to 3.8%, the lowest since the pandemic began! This continues our recent momentum, with 3.5 million jobs created in the past six months nationwide.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: That‚Äôs why a new relief package, targeted at the small businesses most impacted by Omicron, is so critical right now. I won‚Äôt stop fighting until we get our communities the relief that they need.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: As I‚Äôve met with small business owners and local officials throughout NJ-11, all have expressed concern about the impact of Omicron on our economy and communities. I fear that, without additional assistance, many more businesses in North Jersey will be forced to close.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: At the same time, Omicron has greatly impacted consumer demand for businesses centered on in-person gatherings, such as the @MayoCenter in Morristown and so many of our local restaurants, and has made it even more difficult for them to hire the workers they need.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: The CARES Act and American Rescue Plan were so important during the pandemic in saving businesses across NJ-11, through  programs like the Paycheck Protection Program and Restaurant Revitalization Fund, but those crucial initiatives have now expired.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: This week, I led ten of my colleagues in a letter to President Biden urging the Administration to support and help negotiate a new, targeted relief package to assist small businesses impacted by Omicron.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: The COMPETES Act will reduce costs for NJ families & help our businesses better compete with China. I believe on the whole this bill will have a positive impact and I intend to continue working to improve the bill moving forward.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: My methane mitigation amendment creates a grant program for states like NJ to offset energy costs for families. It also provides incentives for companies to accelerate and expand improvements to their natural gas distribution systems so we can reduce pollution in our communities.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: NIST promotes innovation and competitiveness by advancing measurement science, standards, and tech in ways that enhance economic security. My amendment will strengthen their ability to develop and manage greenhouse gas emissions measurements, which will boost our competitiveness.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: And, with that in mind, my amendment investing in long-duration energy storage technology will help us develop new and better ways to increase grid resiliency and reliability so we have less of the power outages North Jersey has come to expect.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: NJ needs clean reliable electricity. To this end, I included a provision in this bill that would fund research for rooftop solar & reliable grid tech. We need to support energy innovation at home, not buy from China, to give Americans the affordable, renewable energy of tomorrow.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: I was proud to work with @RepTimRyan and @NormaJTorres to ensure the bill creates an expert commission to address supply chain disruptions and establish a supply chain database for our manufacturing sector. These will help us to reduce supply chain problems and prices in NJ.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: To combat inflation, I also authored an amendment to help critical supply chain sectors like the trucking and warehouse industries hire and train more workers quickly, by expanding access to our national apprenticeship system.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: A top concern that I hear about in NJ-11 is rising prices and inflation. Because of this, I made sure the bill included an amendment requiring the Comptroller General to study and report on how this bill will help to reduce inflation and ensure that funds are spent responsibly.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: To that end, after discussing these issues with my constituents, I secured inclusion of several amendments to improve this bill. These amendments focus on some of the most important issues to North Jersey families - cost of living and inflation, renewable energy, and jobs.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: This bill is a strong step in the right direction. Moving forward, I remain committed to working to ensure the final version of this legislation does everything possible to lower costs for NJ families.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: On Friday, I was proud to vote for the America COMPETES Act, which will help strengthen our supply chain and reduce inflation, increase our competitiveness with China, and bolster R&D initiatives that are critical to innovation and GDP growth.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: Today, as we remember what happened, our focus should be on what we can and need to do to ensure an attack like that never happens again. It‚Äôs our duty now to do everything in our power to safeguard our American values and freedoms.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: I could have never imagined living up to that oath would one day mean protecting our democracy from fellow Americans or a former president who sought to undermine our elections in an attempt to stay in power.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: When I repeated those words, the images of the Nazis my grandfather fought during World War II or the armies of the Soviet Union I saw growing up during the Cold War were the ones that populated my mind.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: That oath bestows the responsibility to support and defend the Constitution of the United States against all enemies, foreign or domestic.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: I‚Äôve taken that oath many times. The first when I was 18 years old entering the US Naval Academy, excited and proud to serve our nation. Since then, I‚Äôve taken it throughout my Naval career, at the US Attorney‚Äôs Office, and, now, as your Congresswoman.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text:
Today, I want to share some reflections I have on the one year anniversary of that attack.

On that day, and in the year after it, my mind turned to two things: my family and my oath to the Constitution.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: With childcare, reducing prescription drug costs, and repealing the SALT cap, this legislation will bring costs down and improve the quality of life for our New Jersey families. I urge the Senate to follow our lead.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: It also helps our seniors by creating a new out of pocket cap on what they must pay for their medications.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: I have a constituent who travels to Canada for her sister‚Äôs insulin. I have heard too many times about how this basic, life-saving drug has been bankrupting families.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: It provides NJ families with relief from sky-high costs. It will ensure nobody pays more than $35 a month for insulin, which can run New Jersey residents anywhere from $1,200 to $20,000 a year.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: There were times when I was paying MORE than I earned in childcare. This bill will address our workforce issue by ensuring our working parents can afford (and find!) quality childcare and get back to their jobs!

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: I‚Äôm also a mom of four kids and believe me, childcare has been a debacle. I hear from couples who are teachers and paying nearly half of their income on childcare costs.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: During the pandemic, almost 1.8 million women dropped out of the workforce, many of them due to childcare and school closures.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: I hear you Maureen! That‚Äôs why every time Sen. Sanders removed SALT from the bill, I insisted we add it back in.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: For years, I‚Äôve heard from constituents like Maureen. She says, ‚ÄúWe love living in this area but we are basically working to pay taxes. The cap on SALT has wiped out our savings and taken money away from my children for college.‚Äù

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: In response to these ongoing crises facing vets, in honor of our veterans who have given so much, & w/ gratitude to Vet Center counselors nationwide, I introduced the bipartisan Vet CENTERS for Mental Health Act, which will increase the number of Vet Centers across this country.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: Despite the high-quality care Vet Centers provide, not everyone has access and far too many of our veterans nationwide continue to suffer mental health issues and all too often fall victim to drug abuse, homelessness, suicide or other ills as a result of a this lack of care.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: While the Bloomfield Vet Center is doing a great job serving our communities, the case load they are experiencing is immense, especially in the wake of the pandemic. North Jersey needs an additional center to help address this.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: Vet Centers are often seen as the gold standard in mental health care for these veterans. In August I was honored to visit the staff at the Bloomfield Vet Center to meet with the mental health professionals who care for those who have served and hear them discuss their work. https://t.co/ha1tMdUriZ

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: Since that time the Vet Center mission has expanded to include support for veterans who were victims of military sexual assault, bereavement services, and services for our national guard and reservists.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: In 1979, in the wake of the Vietnam war, the VA stood up Veteran Centers for mental health counseling.  These institutions were uniquely designed to support veterans who faced the trauma of combat, as well as offer aid and support to their families.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: At the end of last week, I introduced a bipartisan bill that would expand one of the key parts of our VA health system that routinely offers lifesaving mental health aid to our nation‚Äôs veterans and address the critical need for it here in North Jersey. üßµ

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: If we don‚Äôt act now, millions of jobs will be destroyed and costs for all American families will be significantly raised. That‚Äôs what‚Äôs at stake here. The partisan games need to stop and we need to get this done now.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: The debt ceiling shouldn‚Äôt be a partisan issue. Congress voted to raise the debt ceiling three times under former President Trump. And going back to 1960, Congress has raised the debt ceiling 49 times under Republican Presidents and 29 times under Democratic Presidents.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: It would cause interest rates to rise across the board - forcing taxpayers to shoulder increased borrowing costs, homeowners to pay more on their mortgages, and consumers to pay more on their credit card bills.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: A default would also call into question just how trustworthy of a borrower the US is.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: If we don‚Äôt raise the ceiling, we won‚Äôt be able to pay back our loans and will default on our debt -- with major impacts on job growth and families‚Äô savings. Moody‚Äôs estimates that this default would destroy 6 million jobs and wipe out $15 trillion in household wealth.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: Raising the ceiling doesn‚Äôt authorize new spending at all - but instead allows the government to finance our existing obligations that both parties have made over the past two years.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: Today, the House voted again to raise the debt ceiling to ensure that the U.S. government doesn‚Äôt suffer a devastating default on our existing debt. Such a default could cost millions of jobs and wipe out trillions in families‚Äô savings.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: I joined Morning Joe yesterday to speak about HR 3233, which creates a bipartisan, independent commission to investigate January 6, the worst attack on our nation‚Äôs Capitol & an attack incited by the former president. https://t.co/aP3YIw3TbS

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: Without it, our country won‚Äôt be able to heal. This commission will help. Today‚Äôs vote was a step in the right direction. The next one is ensuring we get this bill to the president‚Äôs desk to be signed into law.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: The attacks of January 6 are a symptom of a much deeper problem and the House Republicans who voted against this commission are a part of it. The American people deserve a comprehensive accounting of the threat & a plan that addresses how we as a nation can move forward.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: I stood in the House gallery as the mob broke into the Capitol building. There‚Äôs no doubt their intent was to undermine our democracy and do harm to those who would uphold it.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: It‚Äôs a sad day when these Members can‚Äôt even stand to support an independent, bipartisan commission focused on the truth.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: Today, the House passed H.R. 3233 to establish a commission to address the attack on the Capitol on 1/6 and how we got there as a nation. The vote was bipartisan, but far too many of my Republican colleagues still opposed it.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text:
As a veteran, former federal prosecutor, & now Congresswoman, I‚Äôve taken the oath of office many times. 

Each time it‚Äôs meaningful & powerful. 

Opposing a bipartisan, independent commission to examine the events of January 6th betrays the commitments we make in that oath.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: Today, I rose on the House floor to speak about why it‚Äôs so crucial we establish an independent, bipartisan commission to examine the attack on the Capitol on January 6th. https://t.co/85w7oxNfl5

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text:
It also is the perfect example of why we need to establish this commission & take an unflinching look at that day, investigate the security failures & what led to this act of domestic terrorism. 

Without it, we won‚Äôt be able to move forward as a nation.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text:
House Republicans ousted Liz Cheney from leadership partly because she refused to sweep the events of 1/6 under the rug. 

Their attempt to whitewash an attack on our democracy and prioritize loyalty to Donald Trump‚Äôs ‚ÄúBig Lie‚Äù over loyalty to the nation is a disgrace.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text:
Later today, the House will be voting on H.R. 3233, which would create a *bipartisan*, *independent* commission to examine the attack on the Capitol on 1/6. 

I strongly urge my colleagues to vote in favor of this legislation for the sake of our nation.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text:
Funding for state & local gov'ts is crucial to combat the pandemic, create jobs & invest in the next generation. I proudly led the bipartisan SMART Act w/ @SenatorMenendez to deliver this assistance & urge funding to be included in the next package.
https://t.co/OSNqDS3ZZ0

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: The absence of federal aid to states and localities is a threat to law enforcement budgets right now. State & local spending on public safety fell from 2010-2012 as those governments faced severe budget crises, and the same could happen again without federal support.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text:
From 2008 to 2013, state and local governments cut their investments in programs to support children, and the same is likely to occur now in the absence of new federal support.
https://t.co/Oq6i5TR63A

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: Without federal support, they will also have to make damaging cuts to long-term investments that benefit us all, including K-12 education, law enforcement, and anti-poverty programs.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: Beyond jobs, state & local gov'ts are at the forefront of combating the pandemic & poverty. They are funding testing sites, running food banks & supporting businesses w/ emergency assistance. With their funds from the CARES Act used up, they will have to pull back these efforts.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: Research published in the NYT also finds that of the 40 cities facing revenue declines in FY 21 of over 4%, 17 are in states with 2 Democratic Senators, 16 are in states with 2 Republican Senators, and 7 are in states with Senators from both parties. https://t.co/38UYbCQpGq

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: This job loss is not a blue state or red state issue, but an American issue. Since February, government employment has fallen by 46k in New York and 28k in New Jersey, but also by 49k in Texas and 42k in Florida.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text:
Since February, state and local governments have cut over 1.3 million jobs as the pandemic has caused their revenues to fall steeply. This accounts for almost 15% of the jobs that have been lost and still not recovered since the pandemic hit.
https://t.co/djJf6Sopva

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: During the Great Recession and its aftermath, a lack of support for state and local governments cost over 700k jobs and was an important factor in our slow recovery. I worry that we are making this same mistake today. https://t.co/oFS8YEpLqK

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: I‚Äôm pleased to see that we are close to a COVID package to deliver urgently needed, overdue relief to Americans. Direct state and local aid is not in the framework, and I want to talk about why it‚Äôs important and why I'll keep fighting for it. üßµüëá

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text:
Is this going to solve everything? No.

But is this a good step we can take now? Absolutely.

We can provide immediate aid now, and then work with President-elect Biden on future relief measures.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: By January, we could see 3,000 deaths a day and hundreds of thousands of new job losses as a result of COVID-19. We cannot afford to wait.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: The CDC‚Äôs eviction moratorium ends on December 31, which could spark a major homelessness crisis unless we act. This framework sets aside $25 billion for housing assistance to help ensure that families can stay in their homes.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: Retail sales and restaurant demand have also begun to fall as a result of the case surge, threatening millions of small businesses. This proposal will provide $300 billion in funding for PPP and will allow businesses to apply for a 2nd PPP loan. https://t.co/Kk2WDrczZo

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text:

https://t.co/ssien5Oz9b

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: The employment recovery has also begun to stagnate as job growth slows, and we have still not recouped 10M lost jobs. This proposal extends UI benefits that expire on Dec. 31 and creates a $300/wk benefit, ensuring that the unemployed have some extra help. https://t.co/jsJN0Kay9K

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: With much of the current funding for states and localities to combat the virus expiring on December 31, this framework provides them with $160 billion in critical aid, alongside $50 billion for healthcare and testing.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text:

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text:

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: Patrick shouldn‚Äôt have had to fight the VA for care. And neither should any of our veterans. It‚Äôs time to pass H.R. 8261 and ensure that we uphold our commitment to our service members.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text:
I‚Äôm thinking of the tragic loss of New Jersey's Patrick Duva, who died last week.

‚ÄúHis family said VA medical staff told Duva that his cancer was related to the toxic exposure he experienced during his military service, but VA ‚Äòwouldn't document it.‚Äô‚Äù

https://t.co/NB94y6IbMi

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: That‚Äôs why I‚Äôm proud to co-sponsor @RepRaulRuizMD‚Äôs bill, H.R. 8261, the Presumptive Benefits for War Fights Exposed to Burn Pits & Other Toxins Act, which would strengthen benefits for veterans suffering from burn pit related illnesses and est. presumption for overseas service.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: But that still leaves an important issue unresolved: presumption. Just like with the 9/11 VCF, we need to ensure that any veteran who developed these health issues and served near burn pits is guaranteed care.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: And the House has passed my amendment this summer to increase funding for research at the Airborne Hazards and Burn Pits Center of Excellence in East Orange, NJ. https://t.co/7yBeoaH2hj

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: 2Ô∏è‚É£ It directs DoD to provide to the VA and Congress a list of all locations where DoD used burn pits, for the purposes of research, healthcare delivery, and disability compensation.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text:
Last year, the National Defense Authorization Act included 2 provisions to address burn pits:

1Ô∏è‚É£It requires any periodic health assessments for service members to include an evaluation of whether they were stationed near burn pits and/or were exposed to toxic airborne chemicals;

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: One of the first meetings I ever had in Congress was with @Burnpit360, Jon Stewart, and John Feal to talk about how we can do better and learn from the 9/11 VCF and their work to help those exposed to the toxic fumes from Ground Zero. I promised we would not let this go. https://t.co/D4yePHN52u

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: Burn pits have been called the Agent Orange of our generation. And that‚Äôs what it is looking like unless we stand up for our veterans and demand better.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: In fact, as of September of this year, the VA denied 78 PERCENT of disability claims from burn pits: https://t.co/FfqPPYbYdI

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text:
The VA has a Burn Pits Registry to document exposure and health concerns, but still maintains that research ‚Äúdoes not show evidence of long-term health problems from exposure to burn pits.‚Äù

https://t.co/8keS89Fw6d

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: Watch this CBS piece for an important overview of the use of burn pits and the impact on our veterans: https://t.co/rFF0FFJIeY

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: Too many of our veterans have been exposed to harmful chemicals from burn pits, which we know lead to increased risk of lung and respiratory diseases.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: Burn pits were used in Iraq and Afghanistan to get rid of waste ‚Äî and by waste, I mean everything ‚Äî from batteries, to plastics, to jet fuel. And as of last year, nine were still in use across the Middle East.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: üßµ This #VeteransDay, I want to renew the call for comprehensive action to address burn pits and the serious, lasting health impact their use has had on a generation of veterans.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: Honored to join @ParTroyHills Mayor Soriano, Council President dePierro, American Legion Post 249, and VFW Post 10184 in honoring Veterans Day at the Armed Services Memorial this morning. https://t.co/6uC7Z8wbIu

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: Her judicial opinions on voting rights, gender discrimination, and same-sex marriage made this country stronger & will continue to ring out through the ages. She is a shining example of how one person can impact our world and truly make a difference. May her memory be a blessing.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text:
Generations of women ‚Äî my mother, myself, my sisters, my daughters ‚Äî are indebted to her tenacity.

Decision by decision, Justice Ginsburg reaffirmed the ideals of our Constitution and our shared values of fairness, equality, and opportunity.

name: Rep. Mikie Sherrill
tweet_text: We mourn the loss of an American icon. Justice Ginsburg was a pioneer and a role model for women across America.
